translated: Sutra of the Names of the Thousand Buddhas of the Present Bhadrakalpa, also known as Gathering the Great Merits of All Buddhas
Supplementary Record of the Kaiyuan Era, Attached to the Liang Catalog
At that time, Bodhisattva Priyankara addressed the Buddha, saying: World-Honored One, are there any
bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas in this assembly who have attained this samÄdhi, as well as the 84,000 gateways to pÄramitÄs, various samÄdhis, and dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s?
The Buddha told Priyankara:
In this assembly there are bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who have attained this samÄdhi and are also able to enter the 84,000 various pÄramitÄs, as well as various samÄdhis and dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways.
These bodhisattvas will all attain anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi during this Bhadrakalpa.
Excluding the four tathÄgatas who have already attained buddhahood in this kalpa.
Bodhisattva Priyankara further addressed the Buddha, saying:

May the TathÄgata proclaim the names of these bodhisattvas, which will bring much benefit, peace to the world, and benefit to devas and humans. It will protect the Buddha's teachings and enable them to endure for a long time, and it will show the way to future bodhisattvas, so that their minds will not become weary in seeking the unsurpassed path.
The Buddha told Nanda:
Listen carefully now, contemplate it well, and I will explain it to you.
Yes, World-Honored One, I joyfully wish to hear it.
At that time, the World-Honored One then spoke the names of the buddhas:

The names of the Buddhas who appear in this Bhadrakalpa are as follows.
If a person hears the names of these one thousand buddhas and is not afraid of making mistakes, they will surely attain nirvÄá¹‡a.
The wise ones who hear the names of the buddhas should be single-minded and not be negligent, diligently practicing with vigor;
Do not lose this opportunity and fall back into the evil destinies to undergo various sufferings.
Abiding in upholding the precepts, following much learning, always delighting in seclusion, and fully possessing profound patience, such a person will be able to encounter the one thousand buddhas.

If one recites the names of these one thousand buddhas, they will extinguish the numerous offenses accumulated over immeasurable asaá¹ƒkhyeya kalpas, and will surely attain the buddhas' various samÄdhis, spiritual powers, unobstructed wisdom, and various Dharma gates and dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s.
All the various wisdoms of the scriptures and treatises, and the Dharma taught according to the capacities, should all be sought from within this samÄdhi.

Cultivating this samÄdhi, one should practice pure conduct, not be deceitful, avoid fame and gain, and refrain from jealousy. Practicing the six ways of harmony, one who acts thus will quickly attain the Dharma of samÄdhi.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
